Translated Review:
Bellebuon is a modern restaurant where you can try traditional Italian foods.Located near Sant Pau Hospital.

It is a small warm landscape with elegant and simple decoration.If you pay attention, you can hear a relaxation background.

The menu offers a great variety ... from great dishes.For the starter, I had a spinach and the Trytelini with a Rico with a cherry tomato sauce, it was so delicious!The main track consisted of a ham pizza.Really good too!Everything was followed by a double bun served with a spoonful of vanilla ice cream and there was concentrated milk in the bun.

All products are fresh and homemade foods.In addition, they have a wide variety of Lambusco wines, which come from Italy.
The price is not accurate, more or less 14 euros per plate.

The service is pleasant.And if it's your first time there, servers will suggest some dishes and explain how big they are.

I had a good tasting experience.For this reason, if you really want pasta, Lambrusco and pizza, I highly recommend going to Bellebuon.

The three friends and I were very hungry and when we discovered that there was this Italian restaurant, we were all excited about dinner.It was amazing, the food was very made and extremely tasty.We had two pizzas, pasta and a crepe.The drinks were small but they placed, ... it was enough.The prices were acceptable and low enough for good food quality.The woman who gave us the food was really funny and we had a lot of fun since we don't talk Spanish well.He even tried to talk to us in German (our mother tongue).
In general, it was an excellent night and perhaps the best food I did in this area.

On our last night, after two weeks of residence in Barcelona, I have closed this restaurant a long time ago.We had visited many other large restaurants in Barcelona before this visit.Our expectation was high to complete our trip to a ... high note!The restaurant's location was okay to find from Google.The front entrance of the dining room was really nice decorated.I felt the dining room could be a little more decorated.After all the small tables were closed to each other.There can be nothing you can do from a small dining room.

We tried the tasting menu for two.Prices were reasonable.However, despite the lady and the Lord, they described each dish perfectly.Especially the Lord was always very friendly.We were not impressed by almost every dish in the taste and quality of the food.However, the presentation was good on some dishes.
I felt that the matching wine was above average for my expenses.

My personal opinion that loves to raise menus prices and food quality at the same time.

Mild you, the restaurant was full of house when we left! More

Translated Review: Restaurant is required for dinner with one of our friends.Happened with a detention on the same day.Clear and interesting website.We were late trying to find it (who knew the same road had two different names accordingly if you looked right or left).The owner's ... greeting was warm and perfectly understandable, tarnishing the "Catalan humor" and not at all failed by our charm.It is a tiny place (maybe 40 places) but does not feel limited.We chose the tasting surprise menu.They ask if you have rivalries / allergies and work with the menu around them.There was not a single gap with any of the many lessons.Each elegant was presented and described beautifully by the wife / owner.All delicious with interesting tasting combinations and textures.There was a new taste that none of us had ever tried / experienced us completely annoyed.The price point was quite reasonable for a tasting menu at 65 euros, more if you wanted the wine (which I would recommend).Michelin reviewers should carefully consider Con Gracia, everything was great.But a hint for seats, avoid the rear tables.If you are sitting on the bench, you may look at everyone in and out of the bathroom (although you can't see them - fortunately).

The food menu was extremely thoughtful of chef Andres and we tried to catch the dishes and not immediately we are disappointed and although it was the rush out there, the food came out logically quickly with a stunning presentation without any compromise for the taste.
Men hats away and great Kiltro team.
The big boys are in the city.; More

We had closed a month ago for four people to spend Christmas Eve.They gave us a table at the back of the room looking at either the wall and the danger exit or the legs of the cooks in the open kitchen, as shown in the ... photos.
We asked for a table change as soon as we sat down, they told us they would take care of it but they never changed us, though there were two four tables in the central hall for half of the night we were there.
The food was special and some dishes (tartar beef with foie gras) is very tasty but generally serving and presenting the dishes was very moderate like a lunch bar.
When we were asked if they were all nice (!!!!!!) and referred to the table position and indifference to make the change or even let us know that they could not, we were treated as atonement for their fault four shotguns and four chocolates,As in the photo â€¦â€¦ no other comment.Frustration Great !!! On our last night, after two weeks of residence in Barcelona, I have closed this restaurant a long time ago.We had visited many other large restaurants in Barcelona before this visit.Our expectation was high to complete our trip to a ... high note!The restaurant's location was okay to find from Google.The front entrance of the dining room was really nice decorated.I felt the dining room could be a little more decorated.After all the small tables were closed to each other.There can be nothing you can do from a small dining room.

We tried the tasting menu for two.Prices were reasonable.However, despite the lady and the Lord, they described each dish perfectly.Especially the Lord was always very friendly.We were not impressed by almost every dish in the taste and quality of the food.However, the presentation was good on some dishes.
I felt that the matching wine was above average for my expenses.

My personal opinion that loves to raise menus prices and food quality at the same time.

Mild you, the restaurant was full of house when we left! More

Translated Review:
We had closed a month ago for four people to spend Christmas Eve.They gave us a table at the back of the room looking at either the wall and the danger exit or the legs of the cooks in the open kitchen, as shown in the ... photos.
We asked for a table change as soon as we sat down, they told us they would take care of it but they never changed us, though there were two four tables in the central hall for half of the night we were there.
The food was special and some dishes (tartar beef with foie gras) is very tasty but generally serving and presenting the dishes was very moderate like a lunch bar.
When we were asked if they were all nice (!!!!!!) and referred to the table position and indifference to make the change or even let us know that they could not, we were treated as atonement for their fault four shotguns and four chocolates,As in the photo â€¦â€¦ no other comment.Frustration Great !!! More

Translated Review:
It was our last night and we wanted to find a special restaurant to spend our last night.We have found that the places may look good from abroad to Barcelona but what serves you and how it is served is another ... subject.
What this add -on has made us special is Jason, the "Scottish" but really from London.What a passionate and hospitable person to have in a restaurant.
We all went out, we asked Jason about recommendations, so we had the tomato bread (unusually tasty), roasted beef (to die for!)?Octopus - full of smokers deep flavors, duck (my favorite) pork cheek - wow!
After our choice I wanted to try more than the menu, so I order the rejuvenating Palela and the shrimp were so juicy and finally the tortilla - but from that point we were full to enjoy it right.
When we closed our meals in Barcelona, I went from the top 20 but somehow Rao is not there, why?It was the ultimate best meal we had.
I would definitely recommend booking a table as it was bzuzing, we managed it online an hour ago.

Thank you for the great memory.

Barcelona!A top destination in Europe.A city that lives every minute of the day as if it were a celebration.A city that has everything, modern but also full of monuments from other times.A city that is proud of its beaches, for the huge Anony ... Gaudi, Camp Nou and its culture.
Of course to turn all these sights to go for a lot of walking ... and as you walk hungry and what will you eat in Barcelona?Spaghetti?Pizza?NO!You're not Italy ... here they eat tapas !!!The old center of Barcelona with its labyrinthine narrow streets and alleys is full of tapas bar, so to find what it has to be worth taking the credit of your criticism is really a treasure hunt.I will talk to you about a tapas bar that I believe is worth a try.It's "Viana".A small shop in a strait that one could easily overtake if there were no huge queues of fanatics who definitely want to try the pantheter and fresh tapas along with wine or the perfect bartender cocktails.Awesome service, warm people, a friendly atmosphere in a shop that all of a sudden became a company.Maybe I have finally found the perfect tapas bar in Barri Gotic's maze.

We found Viana slowly and we needed a lift after a bad restaurant experience near the night before.We were thrilled by the warm welcome and then impressed by the tasty tapas dishes on the menu.Everyone was great and we treated us as honorable ... friends.

Two nights later, when we found an opponent of graduation, I only accepted cash (yes, in a popular restaurant!) Translated Review:
Last Thursday I left Boston in a huge snowfall.By the time I went home to Barcelona, I told my husband that I was too tired to cook.Suggested that we try the pizza
Place Gusto on the corner of our apartment.We arrived.When we arrived, ... the space was empty.My husband ordered 4 cheese pizza and a bottle of mineral water.
I tied the mushroom pizza and asked for a glass of tap water.The Copteas is gone!!Sarcastically he told me that they do not serve the tap water.I told him I have lived in Barrcelona for 3 years.I put my teeth daily and drink it every day and I am in excellent health.He said something rude to Sanish and my Spanish husband spoke to him.For his faith, the waiter does not apologize, but destroyed the whole dinner.My proposal for Mercadon to buy a frozen pizza for 3 euros will be a better quality and better taste.Our account was 35 euros for 2 pizzas one water and a desert.My suggestion if you really want Italian to go to Greco.It could cost more, but it's worth it.Gusto vessel.

Translated Review:
I never publish criticism of the TA, but in this case I felt obliged to do it...

I had a brunch there in November and it was such a great experience that I decided to go back to dinner and then only for drinks.I'm not going to ... talk about the brunch, no point, other people have said enough, it's definitely the best in Barcelona and indeed, their pancakes will die for.

What surprised me was the night atmosphere, classy but welcoming, cocktails are extremely well mixed and the staff who work there is really very much chatting, extremely accessible.We were with a bunch of friends and we really had a great time.

Dinner was again extremely good, very good value for money.Of course, it's not as cheap as some other parts, a small premium is applied and so it should.I hope they maintain these values to maintain such quality, which is very rare for these types of positions in Barcelona.I visit this wonderful city many times a year and make it a spot to visit many bars and restaurants and I have to say that this place is my new favorite.Honestly, in such a wide variety of options in Barcelona, this space is truly refreshing, so that the hats go out to the team and the management there!!

Just don't hesitate, just get there and enjoy the experience of Kremat 11 either for Brunch (real must!) Or dinner, you won't regret it.

Translated Review:
We were a group of 6 friends (3 couples) in our 30s who went on after the summer vacation.We were happy at the door by Marc, one of the owners and the heart and soul of the famous "be burger" and also the newest "be restaurant".

The ... atmosphere of the restaurant is really welcoming.They present a large choice of craft beer they know well so you can ask for recommendations if you have doubts.We had some bravas potato to start with and they will die for;Not only because the sauce was a really homemade "Brava" sauce, but because the potatoes themselves were cooked by the chef Albert, the other owner.

As the main dish I made Dali, a terrible 150 grams of meat with foie and confit onion just as I asked.My friends tried to be - pol, to be - Mozart and to be - Dolce Vita and everyone was surprised by the quality of all ingredients and the meticulous presentation and plating.We finished lunch with homemade white chocolate cake tea which was the perfect last touch for an unforgettable dinner.

None of us were vegan or vegetarian, but they offer a nice choice of vegan burgers and many garden choices - table that make the restaurant "Be" friendly for people with nutritional requirements.

The location of "Be Restaurant" is ideal, as it is just a 5 -minute walk from the SANTS Estaci central train station and is also next to the "Eten A" stoppage of the underground rail (L 5).The neighborhood is relaxed but central at the same time.This is an excellent choice if you want to go out after dinner or if you want to stay on the table only by cooling.

Translated Review: Diego's Bar Restaurant is really amazing, friendly service and creative cuisine.It is a symposium on the spectacle with an inventive and beautiful presentation on every dish.Also, the decoration is warm, selective and elegant.You can smell the spices in all the environments, the ... different perfumes that float in the air such as fresh herbs, freshly baked bread, garlic aroma and onion, roasted seafood, fresh coffee and the smell of history.This was a meeting with several cultures, we could hear different leguades mixed with the sounds of the kitchen, as the utensils were shaking, the ingredients were frying, some pots that were snowing in perfect harmony.The texture of the ingredients is another testimony of careful attention to quality.They keep boiling time to prove to be cracks or softness according to the feature of the meal.And finally, the taste is amazing, it is a gastronomic journey in every bite, with an emphasis on typical Spanish flavors.Cocktails and drinks are excellent and with unrivaled presentation.I definitely want to go back to Diego's Bar's restaurant every time I visit Barcelona.It's a good value for money more

On our last night, after two weeks of residence in Barcelona, I have closed this restaurant a long time ago.We had visited many other large restaurants in Barcelona before this visit.Our expectation was high to complete our trip to a ... high note!The restaurant's location was okay to find from Google.The front entrance of the dining room was really nice decorated.I felt the dining room could be a little more decorated.After all the small tables were closed to each other.There can be nothing you can do from a small dining room.

We tried the tasting menu for two.Prices were reasonable.However, despite the lady and the Lord, they described each dish perfectly.Especially the Lord was always very friendly.We were not impressed by almost every dish in the taste and quality of the food.However, the presentation was good on some dishes.
I felt that the matching wine was above average for my expenses.

My personal opinion that loves to raise menus prices and food quality at the same time.

Mild you, the restaurant was full of house when we left! More

He found some deals and teasers on Instagram and out of curiosity decided to go there with some friends to open there.First of all let's let you know that we don't impress me as easily with my friends as we spend a lot in different places and ... we travel a lot, but let me tell you that the Kiltro team hit our heads since we entered theResto - bar.First of all I was curious by the name and Francis the magician behind the bar painted the image clearer for us and really made sense.
Then we sit in the bar.Luis Felipe, the Lord, suggested us a wonderful and fresh cocktail to get started and we are just hooked inside.
The food menu was extremely thoughtful of chef Andres and we tried to catch the dishes and not immediately we are disappointed and although it was the rush out there, the food came out logically quickly with a stunning presentation without any compromise for the taste.
Men hats away and great Kiltro team.
The big boys are in the city.; More

Translated Review:
We had closed a month ago for four people to spend Christmas Eve.They gave us a table at the back of the room looking at either the wall and the danger exit or the legs of the cooks in the open kitchen, as shown in the ... photos.
We asked for a table change as soon as we sat down, they told us they would take care of it but they never changed us, though there were two four tables in the central hall for half of the night we were there.
The food was special and some dishes (tartar beef with foie gras) is very tasty but generally serving and presenting the dishes was very moderate like a lunch bar.
When we were asked if they were all nice (!!!!!!) and referred to the table position and indifference to make the change or even let us know that they could not, we were treated as atonement for their fault four shotguns and four chocolates,As in the photo â€¦â€¦ no other comment.Frustration Great !!! More

Translated Review:
It was our last night and we wanted to find a special restaurant to spend our last night.We have found that the places may look good from abroad to Barcelona but what serves you and how it is served is another ... subject.
What this add -on has made us special is Jason, the "Scottish" but really from London.What a passionate and hospitable person to have in a restaurant.
We all went out, we asked Jason about recommendations, so we had the tomato bread (unusually tasty), roasted beef (to die for!)?Octopus - full of smokers deep flavors, duck (my favorite) pork cheek - wow!
After our choice I wanted to try more than the menu, so I order the rejuvenating Palela and the shrimp were so juicy and finally the tortilla - but from that point we were full to enjoy it right.
When we closed our meals in Barcelona, I went from the top 20 but somehow Rao is not there, why?It was the ultimate best meal we had.
I would definitely recommend booking a table as it was bzuzing, we managed it online an hour ago.

Thank you for the great memory.

Translated Review:
Barcelona!A top destination in Europe.A city that lives every minute of the day as if it were a celebration.A city that has everything, modern but also full of monuments from other times.A city that is proud of its beaches, for the huge Anony ... Gaudi, Camp Nou and its culture.
Of course to turn all these sights to go for a lot of walking ... and as you walk hungry and what will you eat in Barcelona?Spaghetti?Pizza?NO!You're not Italy ... here they eat tapas !!!The old center of Barcelona with its labyrinthine narrow streets and alleys is full of tapas bar, so to find what it has to be worth taking the credit of your criticism is really a treasure hunt.I will talk to you about a tapas bar that I believe is worth a try.It's "Viana".A small shop in a strait that one could easily overtake if there were no huge queues of fanatics who definitely want to try the pantheter and fresh tapas along with wine or the perfect bartender cocktails.Awesome service, warm people, a friendly atmosphere in a shop that all of a sudden became a company.Maybe I have finally found the perfect tapas bar in Barri Gotic's maze.

Last Thursday I left Boston in a huge snowfall.By the time I went home to Barcelona, I told my husband that I was too tired to cook.Suggested that we try the pizza
Place Gusto on the corner of our apartment.We arrived.When we arrived, ... the space was empty.My husband ordered 4 cheese pizza and a bottle of mineral water.
I tied the mushroom pizza and asked for a glass of tap water.The Copteas is gone!!Sarcastically he told me that they do not serve the tap water.I told him I have lived in Barrcelona for 3 years.I put my teeth daily and drink it every day and I am in excellent health.He said something rude to Sanish and my Spanish husband spoke to him.For his faith, the waiter does not apologize, but destroyed the whole dinner.My proposal for Mercadon to buy a frozen pizza for 3 euros will be a better quality and better taste.Our account was 35 euros for 2 pizzas one water and a desert.My suggestion if you really want Italian to go to Greco.It could cost more, but it's worth it.Gusto vessel.

Translated Review: Diego's Bar Restaurant is really amazing, friendly service and creative cuisine.It is a symposium on the spectacle with an inventive and beautiful presentation on every dish.Also, the decoration is warm, selective and elegant.You can smell the spices in all the environments, the ... different perfumes that float in the air such as fresh herbs, freshly baked bread, garlic aroma and onion, roasted seafood, fresh coffee and the smell of history.This was a meeting with several cultures, we could hear different leguades mixed with the sounds of the kitchen, as the utensils were shaking, the ingredients were frying, some pots that were snowing in perfect harmony.The texture of the ingredients is another testimony of careful attention to quality.They keep boiling time to prove to be cracks or softness according to the feature of the meal.And finally, the taste is amazing, it is a gastronomic journey in every bite, with an emphasis on typical Spanish flavors.Cocktails and drinks are excellent and with unrivaled presentation.I definitely want to go back to Diego's Bar's restaurant every time I visit Barcelona.It's a good value for money more
